Description: Body sherd of Corinthian Linear Style pottery globular aryballos; exterior: traces of black band above wide band of staggered dots; below, wide black band above second band perhaps in added red.
Curator's comments: For the type, see Payne (1931) p. 284, p. 291 and Newhall, Stillwell and Benson, ‘Corinth: Results of Excavations Conducted by the American School of Classical Studies at Athens - Vol. XV, Part 3: The Potters Quarter - The Pottery’, Princeton (1984), pl. 63, fig. 1551, 1552, 1555, 1557.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 218, no. 7)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 58, no. A23)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.304) (phase 3)
